intro: Davilanthus purpusii, commonly known as the Hawaiian moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
